snippet: Jason Leopold of Vice News uses an encyclopedic knowledge of the Freedom of Information Act to obtain tens of thousands of pages of government documents.
abstract: Profile of Jason Leopold, Vice News journalist who has leveraged his encyclopedic knowledge of Freedom of Information Act to reveal some 20,000 pages of government documents in his reporting; Leopold's work has included series of disclosures that have touched on Guantanamo Bay, racist emails from the Ferguson, Mo, Police Dept and details of Central Intelligence Agency torture memos.
lead_paragraph: Jason Leopold of Vice News uses an encyclopedic knowledge of the Freedom of Information Act to obtain tens of thousands of pages of government documents.

headline.main: A Wizard at Prying Government Secrets From the Government
headline.print_headline: The ‘Rageful Guy’ Who Pries Secrets From the Government
